intro: Leptactina arnoldiana var. pubinervis, commonly known as the hairy-veined leptactina, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its pubescent (hairy) veins, which give it its varietal name, pubinervis. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often blooming during the warmer months.
